intro: Cutandia philistaea var. macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked cutandia, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular, pink to reddish flowers, which are typically arranged in spikes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with similar climates.
